description: '''Juan Ramírez Rivera''' (April 22, 1906 – June 16, 1986), better known as '''Juanchín Ramírez''', was a Puerto Rican trumpeter, bandleader and composer. He was a founding member of the Septeto Puerto Rico and the Grupo Aurora, as well as a member of the [[Noro Morales]] orchestra, also playing with Boro Milián, [[Rafael Hernández Marín|Rafael Hernández]], [[Machito]] and others. He is best known for his popular compositions, primarily [[guaracha]]s such as "[[Anabacoa]]", recorded by [[Beny Moré]] and [[Arsenio Rodríguez]] among others, and also "Plena española", made famous by [[Billo's Caracas Boys]].
